intro: Phaca parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered phaca, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often found in coastal and inland regions. Phaca parviflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
